articles.title: Co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI departs the company
articles.description: Igor Babuschkin is leaving xAI less than three years after he co-founded the startup with Elon Musk, following a series of scandals at company.
articles.author: Maxwell Zeff
articles.content: Igor Babuschkin is leaving xAI less than three years after he co-founded the startup with Elon Musk, following a series of scandals at company.

articles.description: In this post, we explore how Amazon Bedrock AgentCore Runtime simplifies the deployment and management of AI agents.

articles.title: Nvidia unveils new Cosmos world models, infra for robotics and physical uses
articles.description: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a set of new world AI models, libraries, and other infrastructure for robotics developers, most notable of which is Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter "reasoning" vision language model for physical AI applications and robots.
articles.author: Rebecca Szkutak
articles.content: Nvidia on Monday unveiled a set of new world AI models, libraries, and other infrastructure for robotics developers, most notable of which is Cosmos Reason, a 7-billion-parameter "reasoning" vision language model for physical AI applications and robots.

articles.title: Smartee S8-SGTB AI-Driven Aligners Treat Adult Class II Cases
articles.description: Smartee Denti-Technology announces the publication of a case report on the application of the S8-SGTB clear aligner therapy for treating adult Class II malocclusion in the Journal of Aligner Orthodontics (JAO). The report, titled “Treatment of Class II malocclusion with sagittal guidance twin block clear aligners (S8-SGTB): A report of three cases,” presents the... The post Smartee S8-SGTB AI-Driven Aligners Treat Adult Class II Cases first appeared on AI-Tech Park.

articles.title: Red teams are safe from robots for now, as AI makes better shield than spear
articles.description: The bad news? The machines, and their operators, are coming on fast Black Hat/DEF CON At the opening of Black Hat, the largest security shindig in the Hacker Summer Camp week ahead of DEF CON and BSides, the opening keynote speaker suggested the current state of AI slightly favors defenders over attackers, but he warned that was not a given for much longer.…

articles.title: CrowdStrike, Uber, Zoom Among Industry Pioneers Building Smarter Agents With NVIDIA Nemotron and Cosmos Reasoning Models for Enterprise and Physical AI Applications
articles.description: AI agents are poised to deliver as much as $450 billion from revenue gains and cost savings by 2028, according to Capgemini. Developers building these agents are turning to higher-performing reasoning models to improve AI agent platforms and physical AI systems. At SIGGRAPH, NVIDIA today announced an expansion of two model families with reasoning capabilities Read Article

articles.title: OpenAI launches GPT-5, a potential barometer for whether AI hype is justified
articles.description: OpenAI on Thursday released the fifth generation of the artificial intelligence technology that powers ChatGPT, a product update that's being closely watched as a measure of whether generative AI is advancing rapidly or hitting a plateau.
articles.content: OpenAI on Thursday released the fifth generation of the artificial intelligence technology that powers ChatGPT, a product update that's being closely watched as a measure of whether generative AI is advancing rapidly or hitting a plateau.

articles.description: By Farnaz Sheikhi, University of Calgary and Farhad Maleki, University of Calgary Tiny but mighty, honeybees play a crucial role in our ecosystems, pollinating various plants and crops. They also support the economy. These small producers contribute billions of dollars to Canada’s agriculture industry, making Canada a major honey producer. However, in the winter of […]

articles.title: Accelerating creativity with Elasticsearch vector database and the Dell AI Data Platform
articles.description: Building a next-gen content portal? Automating QA for video output? Enhancing editorial workflows with AI? In today’s high-velocity creative industries, such as media, gaming, design, and animation, every second of productivity matters. Teams need instant access to vast troves of unstructured data, including assets, metadata, and context across global studios. With AI becoming central to production pipelines, the underlying data infrastructure must store petabytes of data economically and then...

articles.title: M-learner:A Flexible And Powerful Framework To Study Heterogeneous Treatment Effect In Mediation Model
articles.description: arXiv:2505.17917v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We propose a novel method, termed the M-learner, for estimating heterogeneous indirect and total treatment effects and identifying relevant subgroups within a mediation framework. The procedure comprises four key steps. First, we compute individual-level conditional average indirect/total treatment effect Second, we construct a distance matrix based on pairwise differences. Third, we apply tSNE to project this matrix into a low-dimensional...
articles.author: Xingyu Li, Qing Liu, Tony Jiang, Hong Amy Xia, Brian P. Hobbs, Peng Wei
articles.content: arXiv:2505.17917v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We propose a novel method, termed the M-learner, for estimating heterogeneous indirect and total treatment effects and identifying relevant subgroups within a mediation framework. The procedure comprises four key steps. First, we compute individual-level conditional average indirect/total treatment effect Second, we construct a distance matrix based on pairwise differences. Third, we apply tSNE to project this matrix into a low-dimensional...

articles.title: Efficient Real-Time Aircraft ETA Prediction via Feature Tokenization Transformer
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09144v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Estimated time of arrival (ETA) for airborne aircraft in real-time is crucial for arrival management in aviation, particularly for runway sequencing. Given the rapidly changing airspace context, the ETA prediction efficiency is as important as its accuracy in a real-time arrival aircraft management system. In this study, we utilize a feature tokenization-based Transformer model to efficiently predict aircraft ETA. Feature tokenization projects raw...
articles.author: Liping Huang, Yicheng Zhang, Yifang Yin, Sheng Zhang, Yi Zhang
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09144v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Estimated time of arrival (ETA) for airborne aircraft in real-time is crucial for arrival management in aviation, particularly for runway sequencing. Given the rapidly changing airspace context, the ETA prediction efficiency is as important as its accuracy in a real-time arrival aircraft management system. In this study, we utilize a feature tokenization-based Transformer model to efficiently predict aircraft ETA. Feature tokenization projects raw...

articles.title: Temporal Anchoring in Deepening Embedding Spaces: Event-Indexed Projections, Drift, Convergence, and an Internal Computational Architecture
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09693v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop an operator-theoretic framework for temporal anchoring in embedding spaces, modeled as drift maps interleaved with event-indexed blocks culminating in affine projections. We provide complete proofs for a variable-block contraction lemma (products of Lipschitz factors), a drift--projection convergence theorem with explicit uniform-gap envelopes, and ontological convergence under nested affine anchors with a robustness variant. We...
articles.author: Faruk Alpay, Bugra Kilictas, Hamdi Alakkad
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09693v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We develop an operator-theoretic framework for temporal anchoring in embedding spaces, modeled as drift maps interleaved with event-indexed blocks culminating in affine projections. We provide complete proofs for a variable-block contraction lemma (products of Lipschitz factors), a drift--projection convergence theorem with explicit uniform-gap envelopes, and ontological convergence under nested affine anchors with a robustness variant. articles.title: Masked Training for Robust Arrhythmia Detection from Digitalized Multiple Layout ECG Images
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09165v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Electrocardiogram (ECG) as an important tool for diagnosing cardiovascular diseases such as arrhythmia. Due to the differences in ECG layouts used by different hospitals, the digitized signals exhibit asynchronous lead time and partial blackout loss, which poses a serious challenge to existing models. To address this challenge, the study introduced PatchECG, a framework for adaptive variable block count missing representation learning based on a...
articles.author: Shanwei Zhang, Deyun Zhang, Yirao Tao, Kexin Wang, Shijia Geng, Jun Li, Qinghao Zhao, Xingpeng Liu, Yuxi Zhou, Shenda Hong
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09165v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Electrocardiogram (ECG) as an important tool for diagnosing cardiovascular diseases such as arrhythmia. Due to the differences in ECG layouts used by different hospitals, the digitized signals exhibit asynchronous lead time and partial blackout loss, which poses a serious challenge to existing models. To address this challenge, the study introduced PatchECG, a framework for adaptive variable block count missing representation learning based on a...

articles.title: Objective Soups: Multilingual Multi-Task Modeling for Speech Processing
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09228v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Training a single model for multilingual, multi-task speech processing (MSP) is severely hampered by conflicting objectives between tasks like speech recognition and translation. While multi-objective optimization (MOO) aims to align gradient updates, its effectiveness diminishes as the number of tasks grows, making it difficult to find a common descent direction. This raises a fundamental question: should highly conflicting objectives be...
articles.author: A F M Saif, Lisha Chen, Xiaodong Cui, Songtao Lu, Brian Kingsbury, Tianyi Chen
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09228v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Training a single model for multilingual, multi-task speech processing (MSP) is severely hampered by conflicting objectives between tasks like speech recognition and translation. While multi-objective optimization (MOO) aims to align gradient updates, its effectiveness diminishes as the number of tasks grows, making it difficult to find a common descent direction. articles.title: Physics-Constrained Fine-Tuning of Flow-Matching Models for Generation and Inverse Problems
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09156v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a framework for fine-tuning flow-matching generative models to enforce physical constraints and solve inverse problems in scientific systems. Starting from a model trained on low-fidelity or observational data, we apply a differentiable post-training procedure that minimizes weak-form residuals of governing partial differential equations (PDEs), promoting physical consistency and adherence to boundary conditions without distorting the...
articles.author: Jan Tauberschmidt, Sophie Fellenz, Sebastian J. Vollmer, Andrew B. Duncan
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09156v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present a framework for fine-tuning flow-matching generative models to enforce physical constraints and solve inverse problems in scientific systems. Starting from a model trained on low-fidelity or observational data, we apply a differentiable post-training procedure that minimizes weak-form residuals of governing partial differential equations (PDEs), promoting physical consistency and adherence to boundary conditions without distorting the...

articles.title: A spectral method for multi-view subspace learning using the product of projections
articles.description: arXiv:2410.19125v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Multi-view data provides complementary information on the same set of observations, with multi-omics and multimodal sensor data being common examples. Analyzing such data typically requires distinguishing between shared (joint) and unique (individual) signal subspaces from noisy, high-dimensional measurements. Despite many proposed methods, the conditions for reliably identifying joint and individual subspaces remain unclear. We rigorously...
articles.author: Renat Sergazinov, Armeen Taeb, Irina Gaynanova
articles.content: arXiv:2410.19125v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Multi-view data provides complementary information on the same set of observations, with multi-omics and multimodal sensor data being common examples. Analyzing such data typically requires distinguishing between shared (joint) and unique (individual) signal subspaces from noisy, high-dimensional measurements. Despite many proposed methods, the conditions for reliably identifying joint and individual subspaces remain unclear. We rigorously...

articles.title: Learning topological states from randomized measurements using variational tensor network tomography
articles.description: arXiv:2406.00193v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Learning faithful representations of quantum states is crucial to fully characterizing the variety of many-body states created on quantum processors. While various tomographic methods such as classical shadow and MPS tomography have shown promise in characterizing a wide class of quantum states, they face unique limitations in detecting topologically ordered two-dimensional states. To address this problem, we implement and study a...
articles.author: Yanting Teng, Rhine Samajdar, Katherine Van Kirk, Frederik Wilde, Subir Sachdev, Jens Eisert, Ryan Sweke, Khadijeh Najafi
articles.content: arXiv:2406.00193v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Learning faithful representations of quantum states is crucial to fully characterizing the variety of many-body states created on quantum processors. While various tomographic methods such as classical shadow and MPS tomography have shown promise in characterizing a wide class of quantum states, they face unique limitations in detecting topologically ordered two-dimensional states. articles.title: LEAPS: A discrete neural sampler via locally equivariant networks
articles.description: arXiv:2502.10843v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose "LEAPS", an algorithm to sample from discrete distributions known up to normalization by learning a rate matrix of a continuous-time Markov chain (CTMC). LEAPS can be seen as a continuous-time formulation of annealed importance sampling and sequential Monte Carlo methods, extended so that the variance of the importance weights is offset by the inclusion of the CTMC. To derive these importance weights, we introduce a set of...
articles.author: Peter Holderrieth, Michael S. Albergo, Tommi Jaakkola
articles.content: arXiv:2502.10843v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose "LEAPS", an algorithm to sample from discrete distributions known up to normalization by learning a rate matrix of a continuous-time Markov chain (CTMC). LEAPS can be seen as a continuous-time formulation of annealed importance sampling and sequential Monte Carlo methods, extended so that the variance of the importance weights is offset by the inclusion of the CTMC. articles.title: Peer Effect Estimation in the Presence of Simultaneous Feedback and Unobserved Confounders
articles.description: arXiv:2508.09154v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Estimating peer causal effects within complex real-world networks such as social networks is challenging, primarily due to simultaneous feedback between peers and unobserved confounders. Existing methods either address unobserved confounders while ignoring the simultaneous feedback, or account for feedback but under restrictive linear assumptions, thus failing to obtain accurate peer effect estimation. In this paper, we propose DIG2RSI, a novel...
articles.author: Xiaojing Du, Jiuyong Li, Lin Liu, Debo Cheng, Thuc. Le
articles.content: arXiv:2508.09154v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Estimating peer causal effects within complex real-world networks such as social networks is challenging, primarily due to simultaneous feedback between peers and unobserved confounders. Existing methods either address unobserved confounders while ignoring the simultaneous feedback, or account for feedback but under restrictive linear assumptions, thus failing to obtain accurate peer effect estimation. In this paper, we propose DIG2RSI, a novel...
